file_content.text: Keep your blaster handy; I smell a trap.
I don't like the looks of this....
I'm afraid you're too late. Duke Corwin took his leave of House Rist on a shuttle just moments ago, rather hastily I might add.
So hastily he neglected to pay me. A rather gauche breech of etiquette and... unwise.
Tell me where the duke's headed and I'll disappear.
I want to know where he went.
Had I spoken with him, rest assured I would not be complaining of unpaid dues.
How about I pick up his tab and you tell me where to collect?
I'll pay you for intel.
Very considerate of you, but I don't know where he went.
Folks don't think so clearly when I'm hot on their trail.
Fear makes people careless.
I'll admit, your dogged pursuit has been rather impressive.
Still, it's odd to see Duke Corwin panic....
Regardless, congratulations are in order for surviving this long. It's more than can be said for the last bounty hunter to stalk our dear duke.
You want something or did you just show up to chat?
Stop wasting my time.
I do got this funny habit of breathing.
I like living, what can I say?
I see you have a sense of humor. It'd be a shame to see it extinguished.
More than could be said for your cloak and dagger flunkeys, too.
Don't compare me to amateurs.
Don't let your success here go to your head. Our best assassins don't man our garrisons.
I'm going to make you an offer, and I'm only going to make it once.
House Rist has been contracted to eliminate Baron Zacar Girard and all of House Girard's leadership. We'd like to commission you to carry out these assassinations on our behalf.
You're asking me to kill my present employer. It's bad form.
That's unprofessional.
Hardly. Wait until after you've collected Baron Zacar's bounty on the Durasteel Duke before you destroy House Girard. There's no rush.
House Rist has no further obligation to Duke Corwin. Agree to the contract, you can go in peace.
It's a good deal. Let's take it and scram before anyone else tries to put holes in us.
Aren't you people assassins?
You already have the baron's confidence. You could easily get close enough to eliminate everyone at once.
You're the obvious choice for the job.
Sharp one, this guy. I say we do him the favor.
I don't trust this guy, boss. Zacar's been good to us so far, let's play straight with him.
No way.
Not even for your life? Because that's what's at stake here, bounty hunter.
This is a no-brainer. Don't tell me you've got a soft spot for that aristocrat.
It's a simple decision, really--death or profit?
Double-dealing is bad for my reputation.
Sorry, I've already got a job.
In my experience, money makes up for it.
I don't deal with sneaks.
I'm pretty sure they don't expire.
Look, he didn't mean that. His helmet's just on too tight, give me a minute to talk it over with him.
Look, she didn't mean that. Her helmet's just on too tight, give me a minute to talk things over with her.
I said I was only going to offer once. Goodbye.
Such a pity. Goodbye, bounty hunter.
I'll do it.
Excellent, I'll look forward to concluding our business together.
We'll be in touch... one way or another.
I told you Alderaan'd be profitable for someone with a little ethical flexibility.
I hope you know what you're doing.
